intro: Majana spicata, commonly known as the spiked majana, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Majana spicata is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun.
